TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE.Definition: so good that it is hard to believe, or seeming very good but not real

DISADVANTAGE.Definition: a condition or situation that causes problems, especially one that causes something or someone to be less successful than other things or people

SKEPTICAL.Definition: doubting that something is true or useful

DEAL.Definition: an agreement or an arrangement, especially in business

PLUG EVERYTHING IN.Definition: to connect a piece of electrical equipment to another piece of electrical equipment or to the main electricity supply

DECEIVED.Definition: to persuade someone that something false is the truth, or to keep the truth hidden from someone for your own advantage
